#Text=Chaung Tha
#Text=Chaung Tha ( Burmese ချောင်းသာ ) is a coastal town and beach resort in the Irrawaddy region of Myanmar .
#Text=Understand
#Text=This town is expanding fast and you can now find many beach side resorts .
#Text=Step from your bungalow straight onto the beach .
#Text=Although there are not so many foreign visitors , the number is growing and hotels are upgrading their facilities to accommodate them .
#Text=The beach itself is a long expanse of golden sand .
#Text=Each hotel tries to clean its own beach side daily .
#Text=Many vendors work the beach , but are not pushy .
#Text=Some carry fresh live seafood and will barbecue it for you upon request .
#Text=Inflatable rings and dinghies are available for hire .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Getting in via road , mostly by bus , is the only option .
#Text=Yangon – Buses leave around dawn and take 5-6 hours to reach Chaung Tha .
#Text=The last 2 hours or so of the trip are on very bad roads , making the trip longer .
#Text=The buses make 2-3 scheduled stops along the way at roadside cafes .
#Text=The journey costs around 8,000 kyat .
#Text=Travellers departing from Yangon should set aside an extra hour for travel between the city centre and the outskirts bus station , Dagon Ayar Highway Bus Station .
#Text=Expect to pay between 300 and 5,000 kyat from the centre to the bus station , depending on the kind of transportation , i.e. local bus or taxi .
#Text=Pathein –
#Text=Another option is to take a transport to Pathein from Yangon ( bus , 3-4 hours , 3,700-8,000 kyat ) , or any other city in Myanmar , e.g. Pyay or Ngapali .
#Text=From Pathein you can take a local bus or shared pickup/van for another 2 hours .
#Text=Try the city bus station near Shwemokehtaw Pagoda or hail for passing by vehicles at the northern end of Min Gyi Road , which leads to Chaung Tha ( and Ngwe Saung ) .
#Text=The last regular transport leaves at 16:00 , after which it is still possible to negotiate a transfer from Pathein to the beach via ( pickup ) taxi for around 30,000-50,000 kyat .
#Text=If you do not have a lot of luggage , it is also possible to do this trip via a motorbike for around 10,000 kyat per person ( 2 hours ) .
#Text=Be mindful of the bad roads for this portion of the trip , i. e. , this option is not for those looking for comfort .
#Text=Ngwe Saung via coast and motorbike taxi for about 8-13,000 kyat one-way .
#Text=This includes at least two river crossings .
#Text=Reported durations vary widely between 45 min and 4 hr , so clarify beforehand .

#Text=You can even negotiate with any Yangon taxi driver to take you by taxi to Chaung Tha ( some have air conditioning ) , so if you are travelling in a group of 3 or 4 and you split the cost it can be worthwhile .
#Text=However , remember that the taxi will be returning empty , so you have to consider this when agreeing the price .
#Text=If your trip is for just a few days , it may be better to negotiate with the driver to stay in town ( he 'll probably sleep in his taxi ) and then he will be able to bring you back also .
#Text=Current rate is around $ 120 - 150 one way .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The main strip is located directly by the beach , meaning all eating and relaxing needs can be satisfied on foot .
#Text=The motorbike taxis wait outside most of the hotels and are plentiful .
#Text=Expect to pay 500 kyat per trip , although nothing is very far .
#Text=Sidecar ( a bicycle with a sidecar of two back-to-back seats ) are also available at a more leisurely pace for the same fare .
#Text=See
#Text=Northern beaches are considered cleaner .
#Text=On the other hand , depending on circumstances , beaches in the centre may be cleaner ; after a storm , northern beaches may have black stuff washed up on them .
#Text=Pokala Island ( Just southwest of the Chaung Tha coast ) .
#Text=Pokala Island is particularly beautiful , and just a short motorcycle-boat trip away from the main beach street .
#Text=This also requires a short boat ride ( 1,000 kyat return ) .
#Text=Inhabitants of the island are local fishermen , living together with their families in the houses on the island .
#Text=A walk around the island reveals remote beaches as well as sharp & rocky coastline .
#Text=2,000 kyat .
#Text=White sand beaches ( about 2 km further north from Chaung Tha , go by the Golden Bay Resort along the beach ) .
#Text=Some say they are cleaner .
#Text=Walking there , go past the small pagoda standing on a small hill in the water , there is another pagoda further up , with three large rocks in the water .
#Text=You can get there by motorcycle , but the road is muddy with many ruts .
#Text=Likewise , the beach route is hard to drive on , if you are not that experienced with motorbikes , and driving on sand , you may need a local driver if you do not want to go by your own bike .
#Text=You will find a great place to relax within coconut trees and even a " bar " with cold drinks .
#Text=Ngwe Saung .
#Text=A motorbike ride to Ngwe Saung Beach is highly recommended ( about 1.5-2 hr ) .
#Text=It follows the beach and includes 3 river crossings by a small boat .
#Text=This is a very scenic trip .
#Text=Can be arranged with a travel agency or your hotel for 13,000-15,000 kyat , or privately for around 8-13,000 kyat .
#Text=Even though you might want to consider Ngwe Saung to be the next stop instead of a day trip .
#Text=Do
#Text=Interact with the locals ; it inevitably leads to the best adventures .
#Text=Drive up north for 5 to 10 km by bicycle or motorbike to discover remote beaches away from the busy village .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Numerous shops and street stalls exist along the beach road .
#Text=Here you can buy souvenirs , local snack foods and beach clothing .
#Text=Go into the village for the local 's market of fish , vegetables and provisions .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Numerous restaurants line the main beach road , serving seafood in addition to the typical Myanmar cuisine .
#Text=Most serve mango or delicious traditional desserts as a complimentary after-dinner treat .

#Text=Try to avoid eating at the larger hotel restaurants , as locals complain that they stifle competition by buying up all the freshly caught seafood and locally grown potatoes from the town 's markets .
#Text=Pasta Fresca , ☏ +95 9-422445138 .
#Text=Italian-owned family restaurant .
#Text=Great homemade Italian specialties served in a pleasant garden setting .
#Text=The Italian owner cooks everything herself .
#Text=Daily menu is listed on the board in front .
#Text=Italian wine available .
#Text=William Restaurant and Guest House , ☏ +95 42-42377 .
#Text=Bar , restaurant and guesthouse .

#Text=A pleasant bar and restaurant with very average local and Western food run by an English speaking local gentleman named William and his wife and family , who will likely try to sell you on some tours .
